page.title: 16BOLESWORTH ESTATE
page.content: The Barbour family have lived in Cheshire since 1858, originating from Glasgow, having made money from cotton in Manchester. The estate includes the family home, Bolesworth Castle, and many local dwellings and farms. The farms are dairy concerns, the most profitable in the area. The family run the estate and are continually organising rebuilding of farms and other property. Some of the castle is given over to storage of building equipment. About forty people work on the estate.The family made themselves responsible for local education in 1868 by building Harthill School, when it was damaged by fire in 1923 it was rebuilt by the family. The fields are amusingly named by the owner,Ding, Dong and Bell are three, Uncle, Tom, Cobbley and All are four more.
